column4: Does any particular flavor of multimedia player support/package more codecs than the other?   80% of my "educational" clips aren't playing.  Granted, many but not all, are wmv files.  I hate it but thats life.

mplayer and xine should play everything you throw at them, if you download and install the codecs from mplayer's site...they have an "all" package that has everything under the sun...just untar it and move the whole shebang to /usr/lib/win32/
I've always had both installed and the codecs in place...mplayer is better at dealing with corrupted files (ie. files with small errors) than xine...but xine is a better player
